Line 264: Line 264:
*{{cite web|title= OK State Senator creates jobs|url= http://editorialcartoonists.com/cartoon/display.cfm/97413/ |last=Plante |first=Bruce |work=Tulsa World |date=March 31, 2011 |accessdate=April 15, 2011}}</ref> On April 25, 2011 on Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN), Trump said he wanted President Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth). According to both the Hawaii state government website and a June 6, 2009 article in the Honolulu Star-Bulletin, the computer-generated Certification of Live Birth is the only kind of birth record now issued by the state (original records are stored electronically), so the distinction between "short-form" and "long-form" is moot. When a citizen of Hawaii requests a certified copy of his or her birth certificate from the state, a Certification of Live Birth â what people are calling the "short-form," and what Obama released to the public in 2008 â is what they get. According to Hawaii Health Department spokesperson Janice Okubo, a COLB contains "all the information needed by all federal government agencies for transactions requiring a birth certificate." <ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref> On April 22, 2011, The Politico had speculated: "Hawaii law prevents the long-form record from being photocopied or released to anyone â including Obama. Obama himself would only be permitted to inspect it â not copy it or post it online." <ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> However, on April 22, 2011, Obama requested that the Hawaii Board of Health release a certified copy of his long-form birth certificate to him which they did.
*{{cite web|title= OK State Senator creates jobs|url= http://editorialcartoonists.com/cartoon/display.cfm/97413/ |last=Plante |first=Bruce |work=Tulsa World |date=March 31, 2011 |accessdate=April 15, 2011}}</ref> On April 25, 2011 on Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN), Trump said he wanted President Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth). According to both the Hawaii state government website and a June 6, 2009 article in the Honolulu Star-Bulletin, the computer-generated Certification of Live Birth is the only kind of birth record now issued by the state (original records are stored electronically), so the distinction between "short-form" and "long-form" is moot. When a citizen of Hawaii requests a certified copy of his or her birth certificate from the state, a Certification of Live Birth â what people are calling the "short-form," and what Obama released to the public in 2008 â is what they get. According to Hawaii Health Department spokesperson Janice Okubo, a COLB contains "all the information needed by all federal government agencies for transactions requiring a birth certificate." <ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref> On April 22, 2011, The Politico had speculated: "Hawaii law prevents the long-form record from being photocopied or released to anyone â including Obama. Obama himself would only be permitted to inspect it â not copy it or post it online." <ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> However, on April 22, 2011, Obama requested that the Hawaii Board of Health release a certified copy of his long-form birth certificate to him which they did.
â
On April 27, 2011, Obama provided to the press. An image of the birth certificate, which confirms all of the details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf]</ref> At a press conference held shortly after the release, Trump stated that was "Today I'm very proud of myself, because I've accomplished something that nobody else has been able to accomplish". Trump reiterated his doubts about the newly-released document's authenticity, saying,"We have to look at it, we have to see... is it real? Is it proper? What's on it? But I hope it checks out beautifully".
+
On April 27, 2011, Obama provided the 'long form' birth certificate to the press. An image of the birth certificate, which confirms all of the details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf]</ref> At a press conference held shortly after the release, Trump stated that was "Today I'm very proud of myself, because I've accomplished something that nobody else has been able to accomplish". Trump reiterated his doubts about the newly-released document's authenticity, saying,"We have to look at it, we have to see... is it real? Is it proper? What's on it? But I hope it checks out beautifully".
Trump also voiced new doubts about the validity of Obama's education. Said Trump: "I heard he was a terrible student, terrible. How does a bad student go to Columbia and then to Harvard? I'm thinking about it, I'm certainly looking into it." Trump called on Obama to release records from Occidental College, which Obama attended during the 1979-1981 period.
Trump also voiced new doubts about the validity of Obama's education. Said Trump: "I heard he was a terrible student, terrible. How does a bad student go to Columbia and then to Harvard? I'm thinking about it, I'm certainly looking into it." Trump called on Obama to release records from Occidental College, which Obama attended during the 1979-1981 period.
